description.narrative: 1. The grant for 6 months is intended to sustain and enhance the resiliency of women to respond to violence in all forms, including those perpetuated by the state. 2. Specifically, 6 FGDs will be conducted with 6 groups involving farmers, fisherfolks, women, youth, victims of violence, family members of EJK victims, senior citizens, informal sectors. They will be asked of their own concept of violence, their experience of violence (feelings, thoughts, action when it happened) and their comments on the various forms of violence happening in the homes and communities and how these can be responded to. The FGD results will be presented in a multi-stakeholder forum for more reaction and discussion and to generate collective resolutions and actions a mechanism for continuing learning towards more militant but non violent action to uphold people 's right to life free from violence of all forms. 3. There will be a self assessment of their capacities to sustain protection responses to protection issues of their families as w ell as their capacities of sustain the income earning effort that they have started. The action-reflection-action process can become a practice for the growing organization.
To support women responding to all forms of violence, including state-sponsored human rights abuses and to sustain livelihood gains of eight women's organizations benefiting from the previous project
